text: `@NamedTuple{}` (<https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/base/base/#Base.@NamedTuple>) is really nice syntax for creating NamedTuple types; I especially appreciate it for easily making vector-of-namedtuple row tables (e.g. initialize with `table = @NamedTuple{path::String, hash::UInt32, dir::String}[]`, then just `push!` namedtuples in). Thanks Steven G. Johnson!

elements.text: ) is really nice syntax for creating NamedTuple types; I especially appreciate it for easily making vector-of-namedtuple row tables (e.g. initialize with
namedtuples in). Thanks Steven G. Johnson!

text: Agreed! Also really nice improvement to readability in tests like `nt isa @NamedTuple{path::String, hash::UInt32}`

text:
Or creating a type alias like 
``` 
T = @NamedTuple begin
  path::String
  hash::UInt32
end
```
